page.title: 18Ponds and Pits in Whitley
page.content: The pond to the East of Morris Hill was used for sand extraction. It is water-filled now and used for fishing and occasional swimming. The banks are covered by grass and bushes and small sandy areas.The trees are mostly pussy willow about l0-l5 feet tall, with small oak trees on the water's edge in dry areas,overgrown with moss.There is silver birch,broom,gorse,rhododendrum, foxgloves and bramble. The pond is surrounded by a sandy path with syca- mores on either side. The Townpit pond was possibly a marl pit, but unusually it has stone sides.Forty or more years ago farm horses used to drink from the pit, also they used to use it to wash potatoes. The pond in Dark Lane, opposite Maple Cottage, used to have fresh-water mussels in it, but they died when they were transferred to Townpit Pond, where ducks now live.
